meanings.definition: A type of gas-filled tube used as a controlled rectifier.
meanings.sent1: The technician replaced the old ignitron with a new one in the circuit.
meanings.sent2: The ignitron helped regulate the flow of electricity in the system.
meanings.sent3: When the ignitron sneezed, it caused a power surge in the lab!
meanings.sent4: The ignitron stood guard, ensuring only the right amount of current passed through.
meanings.sent5: The bright glow of the ignitron illuminated the room, showing its power.

meanings.definition: A device used for converting alternating current to direct current.
meanings.sent1: The engineer connected the ignitron to change the current direction.
meanings.sent2: With the ignitron in place, the current flowed steadily in one direction.
meanings.sent3: The ignitron decided to take a break, causing chaos in the power supply!
meanings.sent4: Like a magician, the ignitron transformed the current seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The hum of the ignitron signaled the conversion of electricity, making it efficient.
